p: Vitamins C and E are extensively studied nutrients for preventing and treating macular degeneration and eye-related diseases. They are known to act as antioxidants. Vitamin C, or ascorbic acid, is an effective antioxidant agent that protects proteins, lipids, carbohydrates and nucleic acids from free radicals and ROS damage. However, no significant association between vitamin C intake and AMD has been observed. The same applies for vitamin E. There is a need to fully explore the potential of these vitamins to prevent AMD (Khoo et al., 2019).
